meanings.sent1: The workers had to redrill the hole to make it deeper.
meanings.sent2: The construction crew decided to redrill the well for better water flow.
meanings.sent3: After the mistake, they had to redrill the hole, causing some frustration.
meanings.sent4: She felt like she was redrilling the same problem over and over again.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the drill redrilling echoed through the workshop.

meanings.definition: To bore a hole again in (something).
meanings.sent1: He had to redrill the hole in the wall to hang the picture properly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic redrilled the screw hole to fix the loose part.
meanings.sent3: The redrilling of the hole made the wall look like Swiss cheese.
meanings.sent4: Redrilling the hole felt like going back in time to fix a mistake.
meanings.sent5: The redrilling process created a perfectly round opening in the metal.

meanings.definition: To make a hole in (something) again.
meanings.sent1: She accidentally covered the hole, so she had to redrill it.
meanings.sent2: The carpenter redrilled the hole in the wood to fit the new screw.
meanings.sent3: Redrilling the hole felt like playing a game of hide and seek with the screw.
meanings.sent4: The idea struck him to redrill the hole for a better fit.
meanings.sent5: The redrilling process revealed a hidden compartment in the wall.
